link up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to connect with something or to make a connection between things, especially so that they can work together
link up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The train links up with the ferry at Dover.
The next stage is to link the film up with the soundtrack.
link up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to connect computers, broadcast systems etc so that electronic messages can be sent between them
link up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The Internet allows people from all over the world to link up for chat sessions.
All these PCs are linked up to the network.
link up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to join with someone so that you can do something together
link up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: We linked up with the ‘Daily Express’ to help run the campaign.
link up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to join or connect things, or to be joined or connected
link up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The railway linked up manufacturing areas with raw material sources.
people who link up to the Internet every day
link up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to agree to work together on a particular project
link up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: A Japanese brewery has linked up with a local beer maker to market Japanese beer abroad.
link up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a connection between two organizations, things etc, for example when they work together
link up.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: a possible link-up between the two tour operators
